description: Triangle T(n,k): Write n in base 6, reverse order of digits, to get row n.
comments: If columns are numbered starting with k=0, then T(n,k) contains the coefficient of 6^k in n's base-6 expansion. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 21 2013
prog: (PARI) A030567(n,k=-1)=/*k<0&&error("Flattened sequence not yet implemented.")*/n\6^k%6 \\ Assuming that columns start with k=0, cf. comment. TO DO: implement flattened sequence, such that A030567(n)=a(n). - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 21 2013
crossrefs: See A030548 for a quite complete list of crossreferences.
Cf. A030568 - A030573 for positions of a given digit.
Cf. A030575 - A030580 for run lengths, A030581 - A030585 for more.
Row sums (same as those of A030548) are in A053827.
